name: European Historic Houses Association
membership: The European Historic Houses Association is a partner of the European Landowners' Organization (ELO), Europa Nostra, the Federation of European and International Associations established in Belgium (FAIB) and the Friends of the Countryside (FCS).
goal:
The European Historic Houses Association has been active in Brussels for almost three decades. The Association is the voice, at European level, of 22 national associations, representing together about 50 000 European historic houses to the institutions, the politicians, the media and the enterprises:

• to promote European cooperation regarding the conservation of historic houses and gardens;
• to provide a platform for the exchange of information and support for national historic house associations;
• to promote interest in the historical, aesthetic, educational, environmental, economic and social aspects of historic houses and gardens;
• to promote the extension and improvement of current historic houses, parks, gardens and estates to enable society as a whole to enjoy their attractions, beauty and story;
• to collect, collate and disseminate information and data to our members on financial, taxation and legal aspects of historic houses, parcs and gardens;
• to assist the European Union and the Council of Europe in their development of policy and practice concerning architectural and environmental private heritage;
• to provide member associations with comparative information to enable them to persuade national governments to adopt constructive approaches in the light of conditions and regulations existing elsewhere;
• to assist member associations in their research projects,
• to provide information and advice on tourism relating to historic houses;
• to co-operate with other international organisations, for instance the European Landowners’ Organization
(ELO) and Europa Nostra, on common issues.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Communication, Culture, Customs, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, External Relations, Food Safety, Foreign affairs and security policy, Institutional affairs, International co-operation and development, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Regional Policy, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Transport, Youth
